title: About
text:
I’m a PhD candidate at Utrecht University. For a more extensive overview of my experience and education, see my CV or LinkedIn profile.





Education
2023-current | PhD in Methodology and Statistics | Utrecht University | Utrecht, The Netherlands
2018-2020 | MSc in Methodology and Statistics for the Behavioural, Biomedical and Social Sciences | Utrecht University | Utrecht, The Netherlands
2018 | Post-graduate education International Graduate Summer School of the Global Academy of Liberal Arts | Concordia University, Montreal, Canada
2016-2018 | Honours degree Descartes College | Utrecht University | Utrecht, The Netherlands
2014-2018 | BSc in Liberal Arts and Sciences | Utrecht University | Utrecht, The Netherlands


Experience
2020-2022 | Research and education officer Methodology and Statistics | Utrecht University | Utrecht, The Netherlands
2020-2022 | Research assistant Julius Center for Health Sciences and Primary Care | University Medical Center Utrecht | Utrecht, The Netherlands

title: Hanne Oberman
text:
Hi! I’m Hanne.

A statistician interested in data visualization, interdisciplinarity, and open science.

title: Research
text:
For an overview of my published work, see my ORCID page. Other places to find my research output are my Utrecht University page, OSF, and Google Scholar. I aim to work open source and make my research repositories available on GitHub.





Development
2021-current | ggmice: Visualizations for mice with ggplot2 | R package with vignette on CRAN
2019-current | shinymice: Interactive evaluation for mice with shiny | R shiny web app with demo version and (upcoming) R package


Publications
2021 | Quality control, data cleaning, imputation | Book chapter available from ArXiv

title: About
text:
Experience
For 50% of my appointment I get to teach and supervise students, mostly in topics related to Applied Data Science. The other 50% of my appointment is research time. I’m involved in the Missing Data group led by Stef van Buuren and Gerko Vink, and I assist projects guided by Thomas Debray at the Julius Center for Health Sciences and Primary Care.
If you’d like to know more about my background and education, check out my LinkedIn profile or CV.
If you’d like to see my programming skills live in action, browse around through my GitHub repositories.

title: About
text:
